subject: Re: [junit] out of memory error
msgSnippet: Have you looked at the test to see if there is any recursion going on? Perhaps this is eating up too many resources? Do you get any output or stack dump?  Are
messageBody:
Have you looked at the test to see if there is any recursion going on?
Perhaps this is eating up too many resources? Do you get any output or
stack dump? Are you doing any logging?

Dave

honggangzhu wrote:
> I have 5 test cases in my junit test class. I had outofmemory error
> when I run the test in ant while I forked a separated JVM for the
> test. But if I comment one test case out, it run ok. Of cause,
> increaseing the JAVA heap size also helps.
>
> I wonder if the root cause is:junit assigns each test case its own
> thread. So there are too many objects in the memory at the same time.
>
> or else?????
